answer_to_complaint.description: Answer must be served within 20 days after service of summons (CPLR § 320)
answer_to_complaint.statute: New York Civil Practice Law and Rules § 320
exceptions: Extended to 30 days if summons is served by mail
Extended when served outside the state

motion_to_dismiss.description: Motion to Dismiss must be made before serving answer or within 60 days of service of summons
exceptions: Extension may be granted by stipulation or court order

interrogatories.description: Response to interrogatories must be served within 20 days (CPLR § 3130)

requests_for_admission.description: Response to requests for admission must be served within 20 days

deposition_notice.description: Notice of examination must be served at least 20 days before deposition

motion_filing.description: Notice of motion must be served at least 8 days before hearing (CPLR § 2214)
exceptions: Extended by 3 days if served by mail
Order to show cause may have shorter notice

appeal_deadline.description: Notice of Appeal must be filed within 30 days after service of order or judgment with notice of entry (CPLR § 5513)

notice_period.description: Ex parte applications may be made without notice in emergency situations

filing_time.description: Ex parte applications typically heard during morning motion sessions

requirements: Affidavit showing immediate and irreparable injury
Affidavit of efforts to notify or explanation why notice should not be required
Request for expedited hearing if applicable
Due diligence showing personal service cannot be made
Service on person of suitable age and discretion at actual place of business or dwelling
Mailing copy to defendant's last known address within 10 days

service_by_mail.description: Service by mail extends response time by 5 days (CPLR § 2103)

electronic_service.description: Electronic service extends response time by 1 day
